intro: Sphaeralcea psoraloides, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Sphaeralcea psoraloides is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
